posttest.question: Which principle is followed when granting privileges to database users?

explanations.b: Correct! The principle of least privilege grants users only necessary permissions.

posttest.question: Which of the following is NOT a password policy feature?

explanations.a: Password length and complexity is part of password policy.
explanations.b: Password expiry is a common password policy feature.
explanations.c: Correct! Session timeout is part of session management, not password policy.
explanations.d: Account locking is part of password policy for security.

posttest.question: What happens when a user exceeds the allowed number of failed login attempts?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Failed attempts do not grant privileges.
explanations.b: Correct! Accounts lock after repeated failed login attempts.
explanations.c: Passwords do not reset automatically due to failed logins.
explanations.d: Incorrect. There is a security action taken.
